image.altText: An artist's impression of a large multi-storey building with a Woolworths supermarket at ground level.

props.synopsis: The retail giant is using development fast-track schemes to push ahead with new supermarket and apartment projects opposed by local councils.

title.children: Woolworths accused of exploiting affordable housing schemes to ram through projects

image.altText: A person's silhouette stands in front of a multicoloured projected graphic of a Bitcoin token.

props.synopsis: It remains a useful tool for some nefarious operators, including global crime gangs and questionable governments, but Bitcoin's role has been usurped by stablecoins — one in particular.

title.children: Bitcoin slinks to shadows as crypto bros turn to new kid on the blockchain

image.altText: A message reading "AI artificial intelligence", a keyboard, and robot hands are seen.

props.synopsis: The federal government's long-awaited National AI Plan will seek to accelerate the growth of artificial intelligence in Australia, and largely leverage existing laws to protect against its worst harms.

title.children: National AI Plan drops 'mandatory guardrails' for artificial intelligence

image.altText: People looking at burning building in Hong Kong's Wang Fuk Court.

props.synopsis: The blaze that consumed Wang Fuk Court burned for two days, but its political shock waves may echo for weeks, even months.

title.children: Burned nets and an arrest signal a growing Hong Kong-mainland divide

image.altText: A generic photo of a box of Ozempic pens.

props.synopsis: Ozempic-style medications have been recommended as long-term treatments for obesity under new guidelines released by the World Health Organization.

title.children: WHO gives green-light to Ozempic-style drugs for obesity

image.altText: An older white man with thin brown/grey hair wears a black suit and tie and looks serious.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is expected to send his special envoy Steven Witkoff to Moscow this week to talk about a revised proposal for peace in Ukraine. There are five regions central to negotiations and Vladimir Putin wants them all.

title.children: The Ukraine regions Vladimir Putin does not hold, but wants anyway

image.altText: An aerial photo of a new housing estate with empty blocks and several new houses being built.

props.synopsis: The public policy think tank, CEDA, believes Australia could increase its current housing stock by nine per cent if just one in four standalone homes in the five biggest cities are developed into dual occupancies.

title.children: Overlooked solution to housing crisis could unlock a million new homes: CEDA

image.altText: A man with short hair is pictured inside an apartment building.

props.synopsis: Disability advocates say cuts to Deaf participants' NDIS funding is a "systemic" problem that reflects a belief that Deafness can be "fixed".

title.children: Deaf man 'gutted and sick' after NDIS slashes interpreter funding

image.altText: A car sits in the remains of a house that has been destroyed by flooding

props.synopsis: Indonesia, Thailand and Sri Lanka are reeling from flooding that has killed hundreds in each country and destroyed communities.

title.children: More than 1,160 dead after extreme flooding across Asia

image.altText: 'Yes stadium' and 'No stadium' stickers composite image.

props.synopsis: By the end of this week, Tasmania will know whether or not Hobart will have a new AFL stadium. Many Tasmanians are still making up their own minds about whether they support it or not.

title.children: 'Hopefully it's not like the Spirits': Opinions mixed as Hobart stadium vote looms

image.altText: An image of three young people, two female and one male, looking at mobile phones. A bright pink background is behind them.

props.synopsis: BTN surveyed more than 17,000 Australians under 16 about the federal government's upcoming social media ban. This is what they said.

title.children: What 17,000+ young people think about the social media ban

image.altText: A cricketer in white holds a pink ball aloft, surrounded by clapping teammates

props.synopsis: Day-night Test cricket provides Australia with one of the most potent home advantages in the history of the sport. Ten years into its existence, these are the numbers behind the format, its best performers and the ways England could spring an upset in Brisbane.

title.children: The numbers and narrative behind Australia's staggering pink ball success

image.altText: A group of sportsmen celebrate while holding a trophy

props.synopsis: R360's announcement it is not going to be ready in 2026 brings back memories of previous attempts to set up rebel sporting competitions, almost all of which have failed.

title.children: The mostly unsuccessful history of breakaway leagues as R360 postponed

image.altText: Luigi Mangione, a man in his late 20s, walking in a prison jumpsuit, guided by two armed officers.

props.synopsis: Mr Mangione, who was arrested in 2024, has been charged with fatally shooting UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in Midtown Manhattan.

title.children: Luigi Mangione faces key evidence hearings over US healthcare executive's killing

image.altText: A mugshot of infamous drug cartel leader Pablo Escobar.

props.synopsis: More than three decades since his death in a rooftop shootout with police, the legacy of cocaine king Pablo Escobar continues to affect Colombia.

title.children: A phone call. A manhunt. A gunshot: Inside Pablo Escobar's last day

image.altText: Six different gift cards from Australian retailers

props.synopsis: If you receive a gift card for Christmas this year you might fall foul of "activation rules". Here's how.

title.children: You should read the fine print when purchasing a gift card

image.altText: Tiny red mushrooms out of the ground.

props.synopsis: Mushrooms hit the headlines this year, but not for the best reasons. It's time to change that — take our quiz to see how many fun fungi facts you know.

title.children: Put the fun back into fungi. Test your mushroom facts in our quiz

image.altText: An aerial view of two people standing next to hiking tents near a rocky outcrop overlooking a lake down below.

props.synopsis: There are concerns that social media is leading to poor bushwalking decisions with trends such as "rawdogging" a hike glorifying a lack of preparedness.

title.children: Is social media masking the challenges of bushwalking?

image.altText: Upset couple holding number plate outside gates with caravans in background.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Zone RV employees are out of work weeks before Christmas after arriving at work on Monday morning and being told the bad news.

title.children: Customers 'angry' as caravan manufacturer collapses into administration

image.altText: Generic picture of Australian bank notes

props.synopsis: A financial election advantage for the three biggest Victorian political parties will be removed in the face of a High Court challenge that has argued the state's donation laws are unconstitutional.

title.children: Victoria changes 'unconstitutional' donation laws amid court challenge

image.altText: Two pictures, one of fire burning on a road, and the other of a car covered in snow.

props.synopsis: Summer has arrived in Australia with a bang, with fire and searing heat in the west, while a sprinkling of snow accompanied record cold temperatures in the south-east of the country.

title.children: Heat and fires in the west, while record cold delivers snow in the east

image.altText: A close-up photo of Richard Marles.

props.synopsis: Three groups within Defence will be rolled into one entity as part of a sweeping restructure of the department.

title.children: Government unveils Department of Defence overhauls amid delays, blowouts

image.altText: A woman with shoulder-length brown hair speaks into a microphone while looking at someone out of frame

props.synopsis: Tulip Siddiq says the decision should be treated with "contempt", while her political party says she was not afforded due process.

title.children: 'Kangaroo court': UK MP lashes Bangladeshi court over corruption conviction

image.altText: Trump furrows his brow. The corners of his mouth are drawn down

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says Venezuela's airspace should be considered closed. According to international law, it's not that simple.

title.children: Trump wants Venezuela's airspace closed — but international law stands in the way

image.altText: A hand holds a smartphone with a text message claiming to be from Australia Post, asking to arrange a 'redelivery'

props.synopsis: Organisations using branded identifiers in their text messages to consumers will need to register them by July 1, 2026, or risk being mistaken for a scam.

title.children: Businesses that send SMS messages now need to register their IDs

image.altText: Bamboo scaffolding burns and falls to the ground from a high-rise apartment building

props.synopsis: Hong Kong's anti-corruption agency has arrested 13 people, including the directors and an engineering consultant of a construction company.

title.children: Netting on apartment complex did not meet fire resistance code, Hong Kong officials say

image.altText: A young woman cutting a birthday cake

props.synopsis: The jury in the former Innisfail nurse's murder trial has heard more than three weeks of evidence.

title.children: Closing arguments to begin in trial of Rajwinder Singh, accused of killing Toyah Cordingley

image.altText: Ozempic is displayed in a pharmacy in Provo

props.synopsis: Australia's medicines regulator issues a safety warning over the potential risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviours when taking Ozempic-style drugs.

title.children: New warning for Ozempic-style drugs over risk of suicidal thoughts

image.altText: A very young bird standing up on a town in a red container

props.synopsis: The NSW government's flagship renewable energy project has come under fire after trees containing dozens of hatchlings were cut down.

title.children: 'Unnecessary tragedy' as hatchlings' habitat cut down for renewables project

image.altText: An aerial view of poweer station with two large smoke stacks.

props.synopsis: The energy grid is not ready for the closure of the Eraring coal plant, the energy operator has warned, raising the threat of widespread blackouts in eastern Australia.

title.children: Grid 'not ready' for coal plant's closure as AEMO warns of blackout risk

image.altText: Police and authorities stand inspecting helicopter crash on sandbar.

props.synopsis: The executive assistant of chief pilot Ashley Jenkinson has appeared before a coronial inquest into the 2023 tragedy.

title.children: Inquest into fatal Sea World helicopter crash hears pilot prioritised safety

image.altText: Sam Kerr sits on the bench with her hands together during an Australian Matildas football match.

props.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr is running out of chances to make her long-awaited return from a knee injury, as the Australian team faces New Zealand's Football Ferns in their last scheduled match before next year's Asian Cup.

title.children: Sam Kerr 'in the mix' for Matildas return on Tuesday night

image.altText: Two gunshots smash glass, reflection of police car in window

props.synopsis: An inquest into a 2024 police shooting in Nowra on the NSW South Coast hears police gunned down a man who was carrying a fake gun with the intention of being killed.

title.children: Inquest told man was carrying fake gun before being shot by police

image.altText: People, some dressed in white sit and stand in a carpark near trucks that say Auspork and a red fire engine.

props.synopsis: Almost two dozen workers have fallen ill after a carbon monoxide leak at a pork processing plant in Derrimut.

title.children: Multiple meat workers in hospital after carbon monoxide leak in Melbourne

image.altText: A large pavlova topped with raspberries, strawberries and dusted with freeze dried raspberries. On an outdoor table.

props.synopsis: Summer desserts are for sharing and we have 10 options for end-of-year gatherings and Christmas.

title.children: Our best summer desserts for the festive season
